channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Changed release id on 10.5 branch to 10.5.3.0. Also checked in new version of release notes. The regression tests ran cleanly for me except for the following error. I don't think this is caused by either of my changes. Committed changes at subversion revision 802197.

There was 1 failure:
1) testStartStopManagementFromApplication(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.management.ManagementMBeanTest)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<5> but was:<6>
at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.management.ManagementMBeanTest.startStopManagement(ManagementMBeanTest.java:76)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.management.ManagementMBeanTest.testStartStopManagementFromApplication(ManagementMBeanTest.java:56)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase.runBare(BaseTestCase.java:109)
at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestSetup.run(BaseTestSetup.java:57)
at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)
at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestSetup.run(BaseTestSetup.java:57)

FAILURES!!!
Tests run: 9885, Failures: 1, Errors: 0
Added DERBY-4310 and DERBY-4155 to the release notes and updated the STATUS file. Subversion revision: 802836.

Rick, I was looking at the results after my 10.5 change this weekend.. All seems fine with the Sun runs, but the IBM runs seem to have fallen over badly. I am investigating. It may be an environmental issue. I did run tests with the change and IBM 1.6 before checking in.
Thanks for the heads-up, Kathey. I'm going to go ahead and build the release candidate at 10:00 am but I'll hold off calling a vote until I hear more from you.

Myrna analyzed the issues and determined

  • The windows run failed to start due to a configuration issue.
  • The linux run coincided with some vmware changes which in addition to introducing another variable seemed to cause our vm's to get reverted. Only 1.4.2. started and hung but many tests failed before this occurred, mostly related to network server bind errors. We also had a strange failure I have never seen before:
      • Start: TestDurabilityProperty jdk1.4.2 storeall:storemore 2009-08-08 23:00:19 ***
        1a2,5
        > FAIL – derby.system.durability=test mode seems to be broken.
        > – In this mode one would expect that inserts with autocommit off and on would be in the same range as syncs are not happening but the difference here seems to be more than the approximate estimated range.
        > – Also comparing the time taken to do the inserts without this property set seems to be in the same range as with this property set.
        > – Please note this test times inserts and approximate estimates were considered to report this observation.
        Test Failed.

Myrna and I are starting manual runs now on both Windows and Linux with the right vms and without vmware. Prior to my checkin I ran suites.All and derbyall on IBM 1.6 on Windows XP and it ran fine.

Attaching derby-4344-01-aa-includeJapaneseBrazilianDocSources.diff. This patch adds the Japanese and Brazilian document sources to Derby source distributions. Touches the following file:

M tools/release/build.xml

Committed at subversion revision 802916.
Merged revision 802916 from trunk to 10.5 branch at subversion 802917.
FYI: My Linux run with IBM 1.5 SR10 ran fine with 10.5.3.0 - (802479). I hit only DERBY-1913 and DERBY-2449.
Bumped the 10.5 release id to 10.5.3.1 at subversion revision 803197.
Bumped the 10.5 release id to 10.5.4.0 at subversion revision 807226.

Created tag for 10.5.3.0 code at subversion revision 807232.

Created tag for 10.5.3.0 docs at subversion revision 807233.
Checked in 10.5.3.0 jar files at subversion revision 807244.
Wired 10.5.3.0 release into the upgrade suite at subversion revision 807264.
Added 10.5.3.0 to list of releases in STATUS files on trunk and 10.5 branch at subversion revisions 807266 and 807270.
Committed first rash of changes to the website at subversion revision 807344.

> Bumped the 10.5 release id to 10.5.4.0 at subversion revision 807226.

I thought we didn't bump the third digit until we'd produce the first RC for the next 10.5 release. If we follow the pattern used on the other branches, the 10.5 branch should now be at version 10.5.3.1.
Thanks, Knut. You are right, that is the pattern we have been following. Version on 10.5 branch changed to 10.5.3.1 at subversion revision 807603.

Updated the Derby website:

1) Added the release of 10.5.3.0 to the news section on the front page

2) Updated the ApacheCon pointer there to refer to the upcoming ApacheCon USA rather than last year's event

3) Fixed a broken link on the 10.3.3.0 release page

Committed at subversion revision 817795.
Marking task resolved. All outstanding work for the 10.5.3 release is complete, I believe.
Closing issue.
